Committees and Commissions
The President reported that the Canada-United States Com-
mittee on Education was discontinued as of July 24, 196I.
The President reported that the Committee on Language and
Area Centers was discontinued on July 28, T961 after the comple¬
tion of its study.
The President reported the appointment of a Special Com¬
mittee on Council International Activities with the following"
membership: 0. Meredith Wilson, Chairman]" Fred C. Cole; David
D. Henry; Katherine E. McBride; and Grayson Kirk. The purpose
of this Committee was to meet with representatives of foundations
to consider the relationship to the Council of the new agency in
international education proposed by the Committee on the Univer¬
sity and World Affairs. It was further reported that this Com¬
mittee, having completed its assignment, was discontinued on
Spetember 6, 1961.
The President of the Council was instructed to meet with
the members of the Pacific Coast Committee at an early date and
discuss with them the reorganization plans of the Council with
regard to continuance of this Committee.
The President reported that the Commission on the Educa¬
tion of Women has been discontinued because funds are not availa¬
ble for further operations.
He further reported that the members of the Commission
have been invited to serve on a Committee for the Conference
on the Continuing Education of Women. A grant from the Carnegie
Corporation will make possible a conference on this subject in
the summer of 1962. The committee will continue up to and through
the conference with responsibilities for conference planning.
The future role of the Council on Cooperation in Teacher
Education in relation to the American Council on Education was
discussed. Mention was made of the valuable functions performed
by the CCTE in recent years. It was VOTED that Council soonsor-
ship of CCTE be discontinued and that the Council’s concern in
the improvement of teacher education be transferred to other
Council committees.
